ARABIC: يَٰحَسْرَةً عَلَى ٱلْعِبَادِ مَا يَأْتِيهِم مِّن رَّسُولٍ إِلَّا كَانُوا۟ بِهِۦ يَسْتَهْزِءُونَ

ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_0: Alas for My slaves! No Messenger comes to them without their mocking him.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_1: Alas for men! No apostle ever came to them but they made fun of him.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_2: Alas for My servants! Never does a Messenger come to them but they mock him.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_3: Woe to human beings! Whenever a Messenger came to them, they mocked him.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_4: And it was said, “Woe to those bondmen – whenever a Noble Messenger comes to them, they mock at him!”
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_5: Alas for mankind! There never came a Messenger to them but they used to mock at him.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_6: Alas for the servants! there comes not to them an apostle but they mock at him.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_7: Ah, woe for those servants! Never comes unto them a Messenger, but they mock at him.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_8: Ah, the anguish for the bondmen! Never came there unto them a messenger but they did mock him!
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_9: Alas for human beings! They ridicule every messenger that comes to them.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_10: Ah the misery of the bondmen! there cometh not: Unto them an apostle but him they have been mocking.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_11: How regrettable of the servants! There did not come to them any apostle but that they used to deride him.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_12: Ah! Alas for (My) Servants! There comes not a messenger to them but they mock him!
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_13: Alas for mankind! There never came a Messenger to them but they used to mock at him.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_14: Woe, for those (unbelieving) worshipers! They mocked every Messenger that came to them.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_15: Alas for the servants. No messenger ever came to them, but they ridiculed him.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_16: How regretful for the servants. There did not come to them any messenger except that they used to ridicule him.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_17: [36:30] Ah, the anguish for servants, [such as] these and their like from among those who denied the messengers and were destroyed (this [word, hasra] denotes ‘extreme agony’; the vocative here is being used metaphorically, in other words, ‘It is time for you [O anguish], so come now!’). Never did a messenger come to them but that they mocked him (this [statement] is given as an explanation of the cause thereof [of the ‘agony’] since it [the statement] entails their mockery which itself results in their being destroyed and which in turn is the cause of the ‘anguish’).
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_18: (Ah, the anguish) regret and remorse (for the bondmen) on the Day of Judgement because they did not believe! (Never came there unto them a messenger but they did mock him!) they used to mock the messengers, kill them and throw them in a well.
